quiz.title: Economics: Elasticity, Demand Factors, Supply, and Price Controls

questions.question: Demand is said to be elastic when:
options: Price change has no effect on quantity
questions.explanation: Elastic demand means the percentage change in quantity demanded is greater than the percentage change in price (|Ed| > 1).

questions.question: Which factor does NOT affect demand?
questions.explanation: Technology affects production and supply, not consumer demand. Demand is influenced by income, tastes, prices of substitutes/complements, and expectations.

questions.question: Increase in supply is shown by:
questions.explanation: An increase in supply means producers offer more at each price, represented by a rightward shift of the supply curve.

questions.question: Price floor above equilibrium results in:
questions.explanation: A price floor set above the equilibrium price creates excess supply (quantity supplied > quantity demanded), i.e., a surplus.
